Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff, modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: Des711
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Istanbul, found this hotel to be an ideal base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: TazoG
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was it's location. Walking to distance to everything you want to see in Old Town. The hotel was comfortable and clean. Some of their rooms do not have a window to the outside. So, if you must have daylight then make sure you request those rooms ahead of time. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Cvarholm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, close to all the sites, within 10 minutes walking distance, the hotel was clean, quiet and the service was excellent, among the best hilton hotels I have stayed at, almost as good as the one in new york by central park. The best of all is that the staff never gave you the feeling that they wanted tips for carrying your luggage, I dont think a person should get paid to give you service that is their job...Ã¤love tmy stay, and my girlfriend loved it aswell! The only thing I did not like is that you dont get free wifi, I think thats a service that should always be complimentary as a servicde procvided.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Briangreenwood
Reviews.Content: This room was great - it was modern and had all of the facilities you could ask for including an amazing shower. The air conditioning system was a bit of a fight as everytime you left the room it reset and it was set so high that it was uncomfortably warm to sleep. The confirmation of the room also said room with a patio and view of the city but our room faced the inside of the hotel so you got a view of the business centre right outside the room. Overall, a nice hotel but glad I got it in a cheap deal as I would have been a bit disappointed if I had paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: 276Ali
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent the Easter weekend in Istanbul and decided to stay at the Doubletree Old Town due to all the positive reviews and it's proximity to all the major sights. We were not at all dissapointed. Our trip got off to a bad start as we had decided to get our visas upon arrival at Istanbul airport - unfortunatelt the airport staff speak very little English and it took us a couple of hours to get this sorted. However all unpleasantness was forgotten the second we stepped out of the airport. The airport transfer car we had booked was waiting for us and 20 mins later we were at our hotel (abt 20 euros, 40 lira). The hotel staff were fantastic and nothing like that warm Doubletree cookie on arrival. We had a standard room which was quite large and looked out to the street opposite the hotel. The Grand Bazaar is just a 5-7 min walk away and the attractions such as the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia are just a 10 lira taxi ride away - we stayed away from the trams due to the numerous pickpocketing stories I heard and also because they always seemed quite crowded. Breakfast was 50 lira per person which was expensive but the variety of food made it completely worth it. We did not pay for Wifi in our room as there is a business centre on the 1st floor open to all guests where you can also print for free. All in all our stay was made all the more special by the wonderful staff at the hotel who were always happy to help us plan our day or book tours. A special mention for Kadir who took very good care of us and made sure we never got swindled by taxis and always knew how to get back to the hotel. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Get Lost Visiting the Old Town Sites if You Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Gee19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, clean, friendly, helpful, has free wi-fi at their computers, and best of all is right on the tram line for sightseeing in Old Town where most everything you want to see is. If you are a walker all you have to do is walk out of the hotel turn right follow the tram line and within 20 minutes (or less if you walk at a good pace) you are at the Blue Mosque (if you aren't a walker take the tram it's inexpensive, clean, and easy to use). Along the way there is the Grand Bazaar (right on the tram line). Still along the tram line and in the same immediate area of the Blue Mosque is the Haya Sophia and Topkapi Palace. You could make a day of following the tram line for 20 minutes, seeing those sights, and following the tram line back to the hotel (plenty of nice restaurants along the way). If you keep following the tram line you can visit the Spice Market (right on the line) and even cross the Golden Horn. No way you can get lost, just follow the tram line back to the hotel or if you are adventurous head back up hill from the Spice Market winding your way through narrow streets seeing all sorts of neat things until you pop out at the top at, guess what, the tram line! Follow it back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay room and location, bad smell”
Reviews.Author: RJDemp
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with a friend because the hotel I wanted was booked. There was a very bad smell in the room when we checked in. It seemed to be coming from the shower drain. I asked for another room but none were available. On the second night they finally sent someone to look at it. Eventually they sent someone to spray it with something. This helped but the smell started to return by the next evening. Given that others gave mentioned a bad smell, it is surprising that they don't regularly spray or get it fixed. The room was otherwise fine, a bit charmless but comfortable. We had a bit of street noise but not too much. The location is not great, much better to stay closer to the hippodrome if you can manage. All in all, this is fine if you can't find anything else but there are a lot better options in Istanbul if you book in advance. The

Reviews.Title: “roberto”
Reviews.Author: Roberto Z
Reviews.Content: Very very good. Fantastic location for Istanbul most interesting sites. Tram stop just outside the hotel for more distant trips. Brand new hotel and high attention to functionality. Turkish bath very good. Not very expensive. Rooms and bathrooms are wide, clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Cookies and a Turkish Bath”
Reviews.Author: jstroh_7
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a great location next to the TRAM and within a short walk to the Grand Bazaar and a somewhat longer walk to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia if you don't want to pay the 2 lira to take the Tram. The Turkish Bath at level minus 3, is family friendly (both male and female allowed) and also the jacuzzi, steaming sauna, and five-head showers make up for the lack of a pool. Somewhat slow elevators were annoying at times, but eat a Doubletree cookie while you wait. Staff was very helpful and we were able to upgrade on our second and third nights for free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploration”
Reviews.Author: Frenchchelsea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on a mini break to Istanbul. The location is amazing if you want to follow the tourist trail and see the old historic areas of the city. It is a very walkable distance from the Blue Mosque main tourist hub in the old city, but not that close you wan't to pop back to the hotel throughout the day. It is the middle distance where it seems too close to take the tram but still a good walk. Taxi's are cheap and easy to find though. The hotel itself is very functional and has its own Spa facilities which guests can use. We used the Spa on both days and found it to be a very good facility and very underused by others. We booked a double room (there were a few issues when checking in and it was second time lucky before we were shown to a double) however the room was clean and spacious. The reception was welcoming, but for some of our stay the receptionist was also the concierge and was very busy. The hotel has a lovely rooftop which is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Oldtown - good location for shaking jet lag”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot to walk to all the sites, on the tram line and right across from the University. It has all the amenities that you would expect in a business hotel. We stayed there before and after our trip around other parts of Turkey, first in a handicap room that was really spacious and overlooked the atrium, then in a regular room overlooking an alley. They allowed us to check in early, which was great. Breakfast is first rate, but you may have to chase down your own coffee. The sink in our room did not work when we checked in, but it was fixed right away. You can find better value in the area, but if you don't mind the pricetag this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel, great location for main sights”
Reviews.Author: Hillpudlian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great loaction for the main sights of Istanbul. The Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque etc etc are all within an easy and quite pleasant walking distance. The hotel is not that well located for nightlife and restaurants though as this is all centred around Taksim square. Thankfully taxis are cheap and readily available. The rooms are really nice. Great toiletries, huge comfy bed, lots of storage, tea coffee etc etc. The wi-fi is really good BUT, and this for me is a big BUT and this almost lost it a star, it is Â£8 for 24 hours which I really begrudge paying for in this day and age. The spa is really nice and although expensive by Istanbul prices, they were not that bad. The massage we had was FANTASTIC. The spa facilities are free to use and provide a great place to recover from the hustle and bustle of the city during the day. The restaurant is nice but drinks are expensive, although this seems to be the case throughout Istanbul. Apart from the wi-fi this is a great hotel and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: lawrence537
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at the Double tree by Hilton. We really enjoyed our stay. Very nice setting, quiet and relaxing with enough entertainment and wonderful amenities to make your days very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rolandtherat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly opposite the tram stop, only 5 minutes walk to the Grand Bazaar. The facilities are good, the spa is very quiet and beautifully appointed, (fresh orange juice is expensive 18 TL each). The rooms are more than adequate, the beds are very comfortable and everything is clean. We used the rooftop restaurant six times over four days, the service and food was of good standard and we felt relaxed and comfortable. You pay extra for wifi in the room 20 TL for 24 hours. You are no more than 10 minutes from the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, the trams run every two or three minutes and Jeton machines are everywhere so very easy to use. Pay no more than 40TL to get to Ataturk Airport, traffic is horrendous so don't hire a car. Don't buy the fake perfume or watches from the Bazaar not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with Diamond Benefits.”
Reviews.Author: RMU
Reviews.Content: I am Diamond VIP. My husband and I checked in at the same time as our cousin who is Gold VIP. He was upgraded to a HUGE suite. We were "upgraded" to a room with a small terrace - no view, just a small terrace. When my husband approached the night manager his response was "Aren't you happy for your cousins?" Needless to say this was a very inappropriate and unprofessional response. Yes, I am happy they got a lovely hotel room, however, the fact that we are Diamond VIP should have afforded us the same courtesy. I plan these annual vacations for a group of 4 couples. We booked 4 rooms for a total of 17 hotel nights because I selected this hotel. I plan these trips. We could have stayed anywhere else in Istanbul, but I chose this property. If HIlton brand properties are not going to honor my Diamond VIP status, I will be happy to move my loyalty to another hotel chain. The remainder of the hotel front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. While our hotel room was clean, they never replaced the used towels they removed with fresh towels. Breakfast was wonderful each morning. In the end, my only big issue was the lack of regard given to our Diamond VIP status and the fact that the night manager's response was obnoxious.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Old Town - Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jdmckay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Old Town Istanbul from Thursday to Tuesday March 29 April 3. We were extremely pleased with our stay. Check in was quick and convenient. We were given a room at the back of the hotel, so we didn't get any street noise. A warm cookie was given to us at check in which was AWESOME tasting, and there was a plate of fruit awaiting us in the room. The room was a bit small, but very comfortable...great shower and very comfortable bed. Coffee and tea making facilities in the room. The business lounge was on the first floor and was always open...no kids on facebook, playing games, etc. Computers were accessible at all times. We are gold Hhonors members so breakfast was included (I'd highly recommend starting your day with their awesome breakfast buffet. It provided a wide array of tasty dishes). Cook to order eggs and omelets were provided by the friendly chef. The servers were very friendly. Service at times was hit or miss...sometimes you'd get the whole pot of coffee, sometimes not, sometimes your juice was refilled, sometimes not. But overall, it would be well worth paying for the breakfast with your room rate. Getting to the hotel was a snap. We took the Metro from the airport to Zetinburnu stop (2 TL each), transferred to the T-1 Tram (right there at the metro exit...another 2 TL ((buy tokens good for both metro and trams at the airport)) and got out at Laleli Universite. It's right outside the hotel...Note Google maps shows the hotel closer to Beyazit. It's NOT! The Laleli is right outside the hotel. When we left the hotel to get to the airport at 9:00 A.M. the tram had plenty of room (I'd scouted it out previous days and it consistently had lots of room). We made it from the hotel lobby to our gate (checking in for our flight, going through security and screening) in one hour and ten minutes. It was extremely convenient. The hotel is located in the Old town just across the street from the Grand Bazaar. It provided a nice oasis from the hustle and bustle. It was a short walk to other sights...blue mosque, sophia agia, etc. Istanbul is a great walking city. We actually walked to and from Taksim square from our hotel, and found it to be a very enjoyable experience. Internet service is provided if you're a gold HHonors member. We'd get coupons for each day for each device (IPad Iphone, computer, etc.). These were good for 24 hours. It was very easy to access. Printers in the business lounge allow you to print your boarding passes. Overall, this hotel really was a find. We travel all over the world, and we really enjoyed Istanbul. My wife and I both said that the next time we come back to Istanbul (in September), we'll definitely stay back at the Doubletree Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: whereswally2010
Reviews.Content: First time at a Doubletree and far better than I expect. Location to local attractions hard to beat. Everything at the hotel functions well. Breakfast was very busy and service was poor but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “ExcelIent”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed A
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and nice people in a crowded area . The breakfast was excellent lots of choices

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay in a good and attractive place”
Reviews.Author: Natalia T
Reviews.Content: Very quiet and very well located, in front of the tram stop, two minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar, close to all important monuments. Very good intercontinental breakfast , the only thing that was not perfect for us was room a little bit small with a very soft mattress. Staff very friendly, and a place to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “we truly loved staying with our 3 teenagers”
Reviews.Author: KamphuisFamily
Reviews.Content: All the comforts of the modern world step away from the historic sites and lively streets of Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Good choice if you are on tourism.”
Reviews.Author: Huaso111
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from main sights of Old Istanbul. Few steps from tramway. Excellent breakfast service, but be sure to include it in your reservation. Very expensive to be paid aside. Very nice experience in the hotel's SPA, although it is not cheap. If you are on a business trip it may be a little far from where you may be holding your meetings, which means a lot of wasted hours in Instanbul's heavy traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Am I getting tired of false boutique hotels?”
Reviews.Author: MPoloSolo
Reviews.Content: Last time I was in Istanbul with my wife a couple of monghs ago, on a romantic escapade recommended by every shrink, women's magazine or tacky TV programme, I fell into the trap of listening to the latest mermaid's song in the hotel industry and stayed in a so-called boutique hotel. Boutique and design are the two of the most abused words in the hospitality sector these days. It is sufficient to blend a bit of Philippe Starck furniture with a wall painted in fuchsia and, voilÃ ! You have a design or boutique hotel. Never mind the flooded bathrooms (Do designers ever take showers?!!!) or locked windows (Are they really that suicidal?!!). The atmosphere is a sombre and the music is lounge-type, so everyone is happy at the end. We stayed ina very poor hotel disguised as a boutique and romanticism went down the drain...This time, coming to a business meeting in a Doubketree by Hilton, I suffered in anticipation, thinking that I don't quite like any hotel that has a By in its name. What is wrong with a Doubletree? What is wrong with being a Hilton? A Doubletree by Hilton sounds like the product of those interminable marketing and branding meetings normally leading up to what I call the painful discovery of the obvious. Anyway, I come to the Doubletree by Hilton in the Old Town. Negotiating the traffic in a car from the airport, paying attention not to run over all the Russian tourists buying anything resembling a piece of cloth in the neighbourhood, I come to the hotel. Nice, clean, friendly welcome at the door and at reception, comfortable rooms, not big but just right. Quiet, understated service, very nice buffet breakfast, decent wifi, not so overpriced, meeting run very smoothly, nice terrace with an unusual vieew and very glld and prompt room service. All that at a reasonable walking distance to some of Istanbul's major attractions, like the Blue Mosque, the Bazaar, etc... Very good value for money and, all in all, a very good experience. Not the best address in town but, am I glad this is not a boutique or design hotel! Everything works and everything works well. A very nice hotel for a very enchanting city. Will have to be back and be romantic again...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for proximity to Old City.”
Reviews.Author: KR1212
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, modern hotel. Excellent breakfast. Nice spa/relaxation area.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Yelena-TA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the midst of textile market. Lots of shopping tourists on the streets. You are very close to Grand Bazaar, only there is nothing Grand about it. Dirty streets, tons of shops with clothes, just feels like you are in the middle of regular eastern marketplace (you are, actually). The benefit is that you are right by Laleli metro station, which can take you to city's numerous attractions. Other reviewers mentioned that the hotel is some-minutes walk from Sultanahmet area, but there are so many hotels that are right in that area, priced similar or cheaper, and the area is so much nicer - lots of cafes and restaurants and little shops - tourist trap with all the carpets and ceramics, but way more pleasant to eye. The hotel itself is ok. No free internet anywhere, not even in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: AntheaF
Reviews.Content: After searching the internet for weeks, we finally got a great deal at the Doubletree.. Hilton and booked it for the 4 nights we would be in Istanbul. It is situated right next to the Laleli tram station (the Istanbul University) and is 3 stops away from Sultanahmet, with the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque (of course we didn't realize this or didn't even take the tram until the next day). We walked to Sultanahmet the first 2 days (it is like a 10-15 minute walk), but the tram is really cheap - 2 liras per person each way. So you can take the tram right up to the last stop and only pay 2 liras. You need to go to the machines, insert your money (it gives you change) and then get your tokens- or jetuns as they are called. You can also buy a card for 10 lira and top it off, if you find that easier, but buying jetuns falls cheaper for a tourist! We took a private transfer from Ataturk to the hotel for 21 euros. Hilton quoted 90 euros for a limo transfer, and really that is just not needed. We finally fought traffic, and were dropped off at the entrance to our hotel, which rose up out of nowhere... It is situated in a small high end mall. On checking in, we were welcomed with warm choco chip cookies (and I was sold)!!I asked for a corner room as I had read reviews that the rooms were really small.. but unfortunately they said that they were all taken... Our room was very small,( by our standards), but was clean, smelt new.. Amazing fittings and lush carpeting! the bathroom just had a (rainforest) shower- no tub, but was fine with us, and Neutrogena bath products for our use... The king sized bed was nice, but too soft for our liking, so we tossed and turned all night... and woke up with aches... I was not exactly pleased with the hotel, given the size of the room, but it soon grew onto me, and I'd definitely give it 4 stars... (yeah it is a 5 star, but in Istanbul, you cant expect Dubai standards.. again- Dubai pampers you!). We booked the hotel through booking.com and my husband mentioned that it was our anniversary, so could they please do something or provide a cake... However, they did not even acknowledge that, which is a little weird for a 5 star hotel. We've stayed at various Hiltons, over the past few years, and yes though this was small, it was clean and neat.. so I wont complain.. The staff especially the receptionists were helpful, especially a girl called Dilara, Would I stay here again? Well if I wanted to be close to Sultanahmet- yes I would.. if not i'd seriously think about it .. More about this trip on my blog http://antheaschronicles.wordpress.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ZlataV
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, beautiful restaurant terrace and great food, nice people and 10 min by foot to the main historical places!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: UKHANOVER
Reviews.Content: noisy hotel with malfunctioning aircon/heating and internet that kept failing. furthermore concierge's were hopeless - dont know their own city whether it be addresses or restaurants to recommend. although staff are friendly they are pretty much a bit hopeless. now that i was there for 4 days i could probably do a better job than them. should have stayed at the 4 seasons nearby. my advice to travellers - if u looking for a quiet room with aircon that works and internet that doesnt keep failing and the hope of being guided by your conceirge then this hotel isnt for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Jack M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Old Town, and is literally within minutes of the best of the action...walk to the Blue Mosque, Museums and all the important places of this wonderful city....

Reviews.Title: “What a place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: Right near all the sights and all the service and facilities you expect at DoubleTree. Good rooms, outstanding meals, and helpful staff. Check out their private Turkish Bath onsite!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in the heart of Old Town Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Valange
Reviews.Content: My recent stay in this hotel was more than pleasant. I was welcomed as a Blue HHonors memeber with a very nice letter, which was impressive. Other hotels would only bother for Gold and Diamonds. The presentation of the hotel and the helpfulness of staff was exceptional. Very impressed with the business centre. Spent there alot of time and it was very helpful and well organised. Breakfast was exceptional with my favourite honey comb that has come straight from the beehive. Delicious. Very well connected to new town of Istanbul and needles to say walking distance from many of the main sightseeing attractions in the Old towns. Hotel has interactive television system , which was able to give me info about the surrounding places to see and some historical and interesting facts. For a person who is uninterested to read extensive Travel guides, a quick information like that was verey helpful. Did I mention the staff was exceptional? If I did, I'd mention it again- all of them very friendly and polite in a very professional way. Unortunately Turkish names are kind of difficult to remember but reception staff and especially one of the Guest Relations ladies were great and helpful with information and also they took care of me when I fell sick during my stay. A great place to stay. Highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!, Excellent property!”
Reviews.Author: MadsUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights when we visted Istanbul. The hotel is located just 4-5 trams stops away from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia,etc...and the tram stop is just outside the hotel. We stayed in king size room facing the street but could not hear the traffic at all. The buffet breakfast was great with quite a few vegetarian options. The rooms were gorgeous. We given some delicious warm cookies on arrival.We arrived around midnight and our check in was quick. Staff is friendly & courteous. The turkish bath in the hotel was very relaxing after a tiring day of sightseeing. Would highly recommened this hotel to stay. 5 minutes walk from The Grand Bazaar. Really loved the property and would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Francois1975
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay, hotel s Ã  perfect location for sightseeing in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Ergun S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2012 and would like to start by firstly praising the staff, location, convenience, quality and cleanliness of the hotel. As I travel quiet often throughout the year I have stayed at many hotels around the world including Istanbul, and I can honestly say that the Doubletree By Hilton is in my top 3 best hotels in Istanbul due to the amazing service and quality of the hotel. The location is perfect for tourists who require being close to all the tourist attractions in Sultan Ahmnet, Galata Koprusu, Topkapi, Kapali Carsi (Grand Bazaar) etc.. Travelling from the hotel to other locations is very good also, as mentioned in previous reviews there is a Tram stop located outside. I ate a few times at the hotel and can say that the food was very good, I do not understand why a few people in other reviews and failed to notice this. The Turkish Hamam, Jaccuzi and steam room are brilliant after a long day of walking around various attractions, towels, robes, slippers and even shorts are provided free of charge by the hotel. My room was on the third floor across the business centre where there is 24 hours free internet access and it was cleaned everyday and very modern. I cannot praise the bathroom enough, as it provided you with everything you required even the water from the shower was hot at the blink of an eye. The only draw back to the rooms was the size, its a bit tight around the bed area, but this is not a problem at all as the room looks brilliant. The only dissapointment was the WiFi internet service provided by the hotel. Although I was expected to charged for internet use, I was felt let down by the reception staff when they told us that we had to purchase two different WiFi connections for two different devices, meaning if you purchase one password you could only use it on one device at a time - this has to change as you are charged 20TL per 24 hour connection. Overall despite the small drawbacks, I would definitely go back to stay at this hotel again in the close future and would rate it a 5 Star hotel, however the WiFi problem needs rethinking. Regards Ergun Serce

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay, in the immediate vicinity of the Grand Bazaar and other attractions”
Reviews.Author: Frank U
Reviews.Content: recommended for it's very friendly staff and it's excellent location in the Old Town

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Jlit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were guests Feb 2012. The hotel is very convenient for public transportation from the airport (across the street from the University stop of tram T1). T1 also continues to other major sites, but the Grand Bazaar is a five min walk, Blue Mosque fifteen. Â  We did not find nearby restaurants to recommend.Â  The hotel is even better than the normal Hilton standard of service. Check in/out was friendly and flawless. Â  The interior architecture is striking, but harmonious with glass bridges in a full atrium. Our room was compact, but very comfortable; very nicely furnished and decorated. Housekeeping kept it immaculate. We ate in the Terrace restarant once -- the food was forgettable and overpriced; service fair. Â However, we had daily breakfast at ground level (included with Hilton Â Gold status). The food quality and service was excellent -- great start to the day. We used the complementary services of the spa each evening. Very nice locker room, coed tub and steam, and separate sauna. Towels, robes, and fruit were complementary.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gina m
Reviews.Content: just returned 2/21/12 from Istanbul and my stay at this Doubletree was GREAT. Very clean, nice staff, the amenities, Hamam, hot tub, streamroom, dry sauna were so great to come back to at night aftera long day of walking the streets of old town! the best was the breakfast buffett!!!!! yummmy....i will be back this Fall 2012 and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChevereP
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, and great amenities... very close to all historic buildings and public transportation (tram) that is great !

Reviews.Title: “Still Staying Here and Love Every Moment”
Reviews.Author: mo_9287
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at any Hilton property. I was more of a Sheraton person. But the hotel location is very convenient and the service is just unexpressable. I loved there service as much as I admired Sheraton's. My room was upgraded. I was allowed early check-in (and althought my room was not ready, I was served coffee and cookies). I have no complains and I would recommend this hotel for all future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Four day break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 377MikeM377
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, close to main tourist sites, welcoming and friendly staff, good breakfast, rooms on the small side. Easy to catch a tram from the University stop and plenty of taxis available. I would recommend this area to stay as plenty of fine restaurants near the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissyPhow
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice in my Turkey vacation as i spent a few days in Ephesus in between. 3 things immediately come to mind that made my stays excellent! 1. Hotel Location 2. Comfortable beds and sheets 3. Excellent staff The hotel cannot be better situated for exploring the historic sights of Istanbul. It's walking distance to Grand Bazaar (5 mins), Blue Mosque, Sophia (10 mins) etc It's right on the tram line too if you don't want to walk 10 mins and the same tram can take you to the funicular that goes to Taksim Square. The hotel is very new and well appointed. Wifi works well and I found the beds very comfortable. Bathrooms are modern with full amenities. We had arrived very early at the hotel from the airport and was immediately greeted warmly by the front desk. We were expecting to have to wait till midday for check-in but was pleasantly surprised that they managed to offer us a room in the morning as it was available. We greatly appreciated the gesture. We went several times to Concierge for assistance to get around Istanbul and was always serviced well with big smiles. When we returned for our second stay, the staff remembered us and gave us a warm welcome back. I give the staff at Doubletree Old Town a big thumbs up! I would also like to mention that breakfast at the hotel is great. It had a good spread of hot items, continental as well as turkish breakfast items... Very plentiful breakfast. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again next time we are back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel in a good area with easy transportation to sights”
Reviews.Author: Spurry
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in January. The weather was a little nippy but this was fine and the reduced number of visitors meant it was not crowded around the sights. The Double Tree is centrally located near the Grand Bazar and within easy walking distance of Sultanamet's attractions.There's a tram stop {University} directly outside the hotel which is very handy if you dont fancy walking the tree stops to Sultanamet or want to go further a field to places such as the Galata bridge, Spice Bazar or Taxim area. The Double Tree is a new, ultra modern hotel, the rooms are well serviced, the beds are extremely comfortable, there's a sauna, steam room, modern gym and jacuzi all included in the room price. There is also a fabulous Turkish Bath which is available at an extra cost.The staff were attentive and helpful and the hotel appeared to be very well run with strict security on the entrances to the hotel. Breakfast was extensive but slightly expensive as were the bar prices, but that seams to be normall in Istanbul. The lower, out of season room prices made our visit all the better and I would not hesitate to recommend the Double Tree to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good location, a bit noisy.”
Reviews.Author: GuilhermeOliveira
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and I got a good rating through Booking.com. Easy public transportation (Tram). By taxi traffic can be bad. Close to sightseeing and shopping locations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful brand-spanking new hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingHigh060
Reviews.Content: The DoubleTree is a beautiful new property in Istanbul (opened March 2011). Everything is new and shiny and clean and just lovely. The rooms themselves while small are ultra-modern and beautiful. The only complaint is if you're looking to indulge in Turkey's party scene you are a bit of a ways away staying at the Doubletree - but no fear - there are cabs waiting to take you where-ever you like. Also, I didn't have a chance to eat breakfast at the restaurant but the lunch options weren't terribly tasty and were rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “location is perfect... the staff is well prepared from the reception to the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Loredana B
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days in this hotel with my boyfriend for my birthday. The location is perfect because is really close to the most important attractions of the city. the tram stops right in front of the hotel. the room is silent and the service is perfect... breakfast was very rich and the staff is well trained. I'll be for sure back to this hotel next time I'll visit Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “The best place in old town”
Reviews.Author: Sam_David_aus
Reviews.Content: Nice location, beautiful room, professional and warm staff, terrific turkish breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good staff, brand new--but also extremely hot.”
Reviews.Author: saritaT33
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 337 for two nights in January of 2012. This hotel is brand new and in an excellent location, a five minute walk from the Bazaar and a 15 minute walk to Sophia/Blue Mosque. The tram runs right down Ordu Cadessi, but we didn't use it much because it's packed. And also because we preferred walking around because that was the best way to enjoy the sights and sounds of this wonderful city. Room 337 was tiny but clean, a great home base for one or two travelers who don't mind close quarters. The rooms are ultra modern, and although ours didn't have a view (it looked out into the internal courtyard of the the hotel), who cares? We didn't come to Istanbul to stay in our room! The hotel staff was quite nice, and they responded quickly to any complaint we had. Unfortunately, our main complaint was that it was far too hot for sleeping in our room and they weren't able to fix the AC. However, after we realized that the ventilation shuts off when you remove the key from the wall (you'll understand this when you get there), we solved our own problem by leaving the key in the wall. Voila! Cool breezes all night long. They have plenty of cookies behind the desk. However, cookies in Turkey are quite different from the Doubletree cookies from back home. But shame on you if you came to Istanbul for the cookies! The hotel restaurant is overpriced, but quiet and quick so I can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Gateway in Old City”
Reviews.Author: leecoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Double Tree by Hilton for our anniversary. Although we live in Istanbul, the location of the hotel is perfect. It is in the middle of the old city. Therefore you can go most of the places by walking. The staff was very helpful and the room was very clean and neat. The price of the hotel is expensive due to its standards and location.

Reviews.Title: “our best wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: jimmy b
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our wedding anniversary here. stayed 2 nights and amazed with the services. The place and the room is so clean, the staff and the workers are very nice, helpful and accomodating. We would definitely come back to stay..

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: patrickHolland
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our citytrip with our 20 months old boy. Everybody was very, very friendly especially for our baby. It was hard to say goodbye when we left... The location is also perfect, walking distance from all the major sights and the tram stops right in front of the hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, definitely 5 star. If we go to Istanbul again we won't look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alpanjay
Reviews.Content: This is an almost brand new hotel - less than two years old. It is located right across the tram station in old town, walking distance to the old bazaar, and two tram stops over (or 10 min walk) from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and TopKapi. Taxi from the airport was about $40. We took the train/tram combo from the Airport, and it was very easy with one transfer from metro (underground) to tram (above ground), and the hotel is right across from the Lelani-University tram stop (not Bezayit tram stop - that is one stop over, even though that is the address of the hotel). Check in was efficient and the staff was pleasant. Rooms have comfortable beds and bathrooms are very modern with all the expected amenities. There is a 24 our business center with 3 computers, printers, and internet access. Rooms are also spacious, with a very modern European feel, with LED lighting and flat screen tvs. Did we mention how close it is to all the standard tourist attractions? We took the tram and walked back at night. We did not use the hotel restaurant so cannot comment on it, but there are lots of places to eat within 5 minute walking distance. We stayed in two differnet rooms. If you have a choice, ask for room 301 - it is a very spacious corner room with the window opening on the plaza, and a very large batroom with a window opening in the side alley. Soundproofing was good and we did not hear any noises if the window was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeachBoy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better. The Grand Bazaar is a few moments walk away and the hotel is in the thick of the action for shopping and the fantastic architecture the city has to offer. The tramway stop is virtually outside the lobby and you can go directly to the airport with a minimum of fuss. Breakfast isn't great but satisfactory. No bacon for obvious reasons and the eggs should be freshly cooked in a 5* hotel. The hotel is modern and well appointed but I was charged for wifi which will literally stop me from staying there again even though I am going back to instanbul again next week. The signal was also very poor and managed by a company in Switzerland so woe betied you if you have problems. Watch out for shoe-shine guys who try to rip you off in the street.... Stay away from them. The hotel door guys are great but the manager is a flash-harry in a tailored suit who makes you feel like you are disturbing his social life. Generally a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: BB713_12
Reviews.Content: The location is an easy walk to the major attractions of Old Town. The breakfast was fabulous and the staff was helpful with directions and other information. The beds are also very comfortable. The bathrooms are sleek and modern including a real hand held hair dryer all of which helped me to get ready faster and out of the door.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard, great staff, noisy rooms at front”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_White
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Good location for Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar etc. * Rooms are well appointed * The staff are very attentive and welcoming Cons: * Rooms at the front are noisy (I'm a heavy sleeper and I was woken by the street noise) and could do with an extra layer of glass * Wifi is not free (Come on hilton, this is an expensive 5 star hotel, charging for wifi is a disgrace), * Minor note: TV only had 2 English speaking channels, both news

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A Q
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree for 5 nights during Christmas. We got a great deal since we paid less than $100 per night (I guess December is not the busiest time in the year). Great location (in the middle of the Old city). You can walk to the Grand Bazar, Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque from the hotel. The tram stop (which I think is university) stops right in front of the Doubletree. Yet, the area is slightly pushed away from the all the tourist traps which was nice. The hotel is brand new and clean. The rooms look like the pictures. We didn't get the breakfast because we thought that it was too expensive. Breakfast wise, you have lots of options a few blocks from the hotel. One down side is that the drains in the bathroom tend to smell. Not an overwhelmingly bad smell but we ended up closing the bathroom door during our stay. Bottom line, if you are looking for a centrally located, new, clean and reasonably priced hotel (at least in December) in Istanbul, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury property with nice rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a number of Doubletree hotels in the U.S. which are perfectly fine, but no super upscale, this hotel is better than a Hilton. Very modern rooms with high style bathrooms. Very modern and new. We had a family of 4 and took two rooms - one a king and one with two twins. They were connected and worked out great! The hotel also has a very nice spa area with a gym, whirlpool and hamman. The kids loved it. The location is right on the tram route, so you can catch it to anywhere. It is also close to the Grand Bazar and about a 15 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, etc. Very convenient. If I had to pick a few cons - we were given a corner King room which was very spacious. The twin room was much smaller, but still comfortable. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctenneen2
Reviews.Content: the hotel great location and service was very good. Yes the room is alittle small but very clean quite.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaliFreak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week (Dec 11->19) and enjoyed it tremedously. The hotel is less than a year old and everything is spotless. The buffet breakfast was fantastic (included in our room rate). My only complaint is that the rooms are somewhat small. Other than that, the location, service and amenities are second to none!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, comfort & location”
Reviews.Author: betsysc0tt
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay. Everything was spotlessly clean and the staff was extremely helpful. Great location in Ä°stanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: Ruby Wax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a short cdity break. Hotel is clean and modern and in a good position for Grand Bazaar and Blue Mosque etc. Service generally was good, beds comfortable, rooms are on the small side and there is no bath. Breakfast was OK but not great, on 2 out of 3 mornings I had to advise the staff that the food supposedly being kept warm was actually cold, the waiting staff in the breakfast resturant were attentive and pleasant. We went into the Terrace resturant on the 5th floor on our first evening, there was one other person in there and no one eating. We had a meal that was very mediocre and not very appetising so we did not return during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SquareMontgomery
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in December. Loved the hotel. Great location: you can take the metro from the airport, next one tramstop and you're there for all of 4 TRY (1.60 euro)! you're right in the middle of Old Town, minutes away from the Grand Bazar, 20 minutes walking distance from Blue Mosque and Haya Sophia. NIce hotel with large rooms, excellent bathroom with walk-in shower. Wifi for free. Good business center. Service was great: friendly, attentive, and available: I never saw lines for checkin or -out. Breakfast was very good with a nice combination of international fare and Turkish delights! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Option for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a recent trip. This property appears to be very new and is wonderfully located. It's right on the T1 tram line. I think the Google maps show the stop as Beyazit but it's actually the Universite stop which is directly in front of the hotel. This makes the location incredibly convenient - either by taking the tram or just walking along the main boulevard. My room was not large but very well-appointed and clean. The bathroom was modern, clean and functional. I appreciated that it was a walk-in shower and not a shower/tub combo. I received an upgrade to a room with a very large terrace. I would definitely recommend this location for visitors to Istanbul as it's incredibly convenient and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great but a couple of points of note”
Reviews.Author: Maria G
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I never seen in my life Hotel General Manager yelling his Staff at the lobby. Please I would like to thank each member of your perfect staff. We stayed at this hotel at the end of a cruise. The staff couldn't have been more wonderful. Whenever we asked for anything they went out of their way to see that our needs were met. They knew it was my birthday-sent a cake. There are three complimentary computers available on first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mossupp
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel. Tram stop located directly outside the hotel. Very well decorated/furnished bedroom. Bathroom not upto 5* standard. Located in Beyazit. 5-10min walk to Grand Bazaar. 15-20min walk to Blue Mosque. Probably prefer to stay in Sultanahmet next time. Disappointed there was no pool. Due to location, no views.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and is modern, new & clean”
Reviews.Author: KathyLB
Reviews.Content: The location is really good. Right on the tram line. We didn't use it as we were touring around the area and was able to walk to all the major sites. For all the highlights of Istanbul it is an excellent location. We had a King Guest room. The room is small but very clean, modern and new. The TV is crappy with poor reception and few TV channels in English but then we were not really there to watch TV. The beds are FANTASTIC. The shower is a nice size but has a removable shower head so it is a bit difficult to get it to stay in the correct position for a really good shower. The staff was friendly and spoke English very well. DO NOT eat breakfast in the hotel unless your hotel stay includes it in the room price. It was good but it was an OUTRAGEOUS price for a buffet and there is no other option. Dinner was quite expensive. The food was tasty though not overly hot. We had only appetizers and shared them. From observing diners around us the main courses seemed somewhat small for a high price.

Reviews.Title: “More like a full service Hilton”
Reviews.Author: orp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, booked through Expedia prepaid and with breakfast. Location is good; Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Hagia Sophia etc., all within walking distance. Tram right outside going to either the airport or into the area with all the sights and to the other side of Istanbul (Taksim, Shopping Centres etc;). It looks like the place just got a full hard refurbishment, lobby, restaurant(s) and rooms seems all fresh and new, very trendy, clean and nice. The room we had was very small, looked like the new fittings was not really designed for that size of room. This was not a major problem, but a little more "floor" space would have been nice - it was almost an acrobatic excercise to use the in room safe. They have everything like in a "real" Hilton, turndown service, newspaper in the room in the morning, fresh orange juice, same ameneties and bathproducts, complementary water etc., guess the only reason it is not branded as a Hilton is either the room size or something to do with brand strategy. But who am I to complain about that. Service was excellent, especially in the restaurant on the top floor (we received a voucher of 50%) and actually we went there twice, good views, good food, good ambiance and good service. The bar staff in the lobby area was not the fastest, and it seemed like this was a part time job for the waiters in the connected breakfast restaurant. I think they could sell more if it was staffed properly. The business center looked good, only used it for boarding cards.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for a four star hotel at this price...”
Reviews.Author: EdmondUK
Reviews.Content: The location surely is the key selling point here. It's a stone's throw from the Grand Bazaar, with plenty of shops and ATMs around. A 10-minute downhill walk will take you to all the sights in Sultanahmet: Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Aya Sofya etc. We did stroll back but for the less willing feet, there's a tram stop right in front of the hotel with the journey from Sultanahmet taking merely 5 minutes. The room is not huge but perfectly adequate for a short stay (a casual visitor won't need more than 4 days in Istanbul, in my humble opinion), with the bathroom disproportionally roomy which I like. I believe the hotel is fairly new and certainly felt that way during our stay as everything worked without a glitch. The hotel staff were by and large courteous and helpful, although I thought the body scan was a bit superfluous but must stress it was by no means burdensome nor intrusive. General amenities are satisfactory: - Three computers with printing facilities (free, I believe) on the first floor. Wifi isn't free but the charge fairly minimal, if I remember correctly. - The rooftop terrace is pleasant enough for a drink before heading out for dinner - The gym is small but nice enough for gentle workout - Very generous breakfast (by European standard) Predictably, the culinary scene is kebab-centric and after 2 days, I defy you not to crave for something other than skewered meat! That said, you must under no circumstances leave Istanbul without a visit to ZÃ¼beyir Ocakbasi (close to Taksim Square in Beyoglu): simply the best kebabs I've ever tasted... If you really can't stomach more kebabs, Mosaik Restaurant in the thick of Sultanahmet would be a safe bet: good food, English-speaking waiting staff and reasonably priced. Balikci Sabahattin, which focuses on seafood and fresh fish from the surrounding waters, is another lovely antidote to all the chargrilled meat.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Giulianini
Reviews.Content: Great location, a few blocks from Gran Bazaar and 15 minutes walking to the Ayasofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi. Tram station front of the hotel. Rooms nicely decorated, and the suite well equipped and clean. All we needed for a lovely 4 nights we found them here. Beds were so comfortable. Employees always pending on our needs. Free internet at the computer hotel. Connectivity cheap comparing with other Doubletree. My next trip I will choice the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: ltt07
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel near grand bazar. Rooms are nicely appointed but the comfort of the beds deserves 6stars. Not too many restaurants in immediate surrounding area apart from tourist traps. For a mote local experience jump on the tram or walk to sulthanamet. If you are heading to the cruise port and do not have mountains of luggage, taking the tram is the most efficient way. It's a 3 min walk toncruisevterminal from nearest tram stop. BEWARE whe you return from a cruise, the taxis that linger around the port are not your normal metered taxis! Their prices are outrageous 30 euros and more for a short distance. We were told that it's a sort of taxi mafia for the port that is somewhat tolerated by local authorities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--Best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: jminer
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Doubletree. The room was very nice. The breakfast was as good as it gets with something for everyone. We loved the location near the old town. A tram stop is directly in front of the hotel. For 2 lire you can have a quick ride to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Rooms, Noise Issue, Location just OK”
Reviews.Author: shendrix
Reviews.Content: First off, I would have preferred to be closer to the Blue Mosque area, however, the public transportation (tramway) is right out the door here, albeit packed to the gills most of the time. I felt like all we did was walk down to that area. It isn't the worst spot, it just isn't the best. Beyond that, the rooms area terrific, really cool modern decor and just overall a lovely hotel. The baths had this constant sewer smell coming out of the shower drain, but I assume this is probably a city wide issue. We kept the door closed to the bath for this reason. There is a nice coffee maker and bottled water (the water is not safe to drink in this hotel and many others in Istanbul) however, I would have preferred to have at least 2 bottles per room because of the water safety issue. A friend of ours was not made aware of this at his hotel and got ill on the trip. The beds were very comfy and nice quality linens. The noise was a problem for us. Our rooms overlooked the very big main drag and the constant sirens and just overall traffic noise were pretty bad. If you can, I would recommend getting a room that does not overlook the main drag. The other issue, and this is everywhere, is the 5 times a day call to prayer on the loudspeakers. The one at 6 a.m. woke us up everyday. I don't know if it could be avoided if you moved to another room that didn't face the main drag, however. It is a city wide loudspeaker thing that is in most predominantly Muslim countries.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: JM1609
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was excellent with private balcony and view. The staff were extremely professional, helpful and friendly. All spoke good English. Very close and easy walking to all tourist attractions. Bed and pillows wonderfully comfortable. Restaurant is excellent. We travel through Istanbul regularly, and have stayed at other hotels, but the Hilton is tops.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Noisy and Hot”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree a total of six nights in late September and mid October 2011. Because it's new the hotel seems well appointed and has a variety of energy efficiency features. But the air conditioning system did not work well, in fact it woke me up several times during my stays because the room was just too hot to sleep (e.g. 77 degrees fahrenheit). And opening the windows, while cooling the room, leaves it so noisy that I couldn't sleep. I tried 4 different rooms, including one suite! But they were all the same. I couldn't bear the thought of staying at this hotel during the hottest times of the year! It's my guess that this new hotel has a fancy air conditioning system that cycles down during the night in order to save on energy costs - despite any impacts on guest comfort. I have demanded my money back (my six nights were prepaid, unfortunately). A hotel is worthless if a guest can't rest during their stay. And my stay at the Doubletree in Old Town Istanbul, unfortunately, ruined parts of an otherwise lovely trip to Turkey and Greece.

Reviews.Title: “good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: danyahALI
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed my staying at this hotel also it's new so close for the historical sites blue mosque + higha sofia & the islamic art museum . it's in lalli district where the whole sale shops are so near to the hotel . there are some shops inside the hotel .it's near to yanikapi port .the break fast was so good while our staying they do not have extra beds and there is no space for it in the room

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - but 1st class service”
Reviews.Author: Doug P
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights 7-10th October. Excellent, friendly staff and good food. Lively area, but hotel is well sound-proofed. A Cookie on arrival is a nice touch and you can get more if you feel the need! â‚¬230/night was expensive but we were told that there was something on in the city to push the price up. Only downside for me was paying for internet access - seems greedy to charge for use when one is paying a high price for a room

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family tourists”
Reviews.Author: Amrita241
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was the biggest advantage. The tram station is right outside the entrance plus taxis are waiting in lines. It's walking distance from all tourist attractions. The neighborhood is safe and friendly. Lively throughout the day.The staff of the hotel at the front desk is excellent. They actually helped me plan my entire trip. I would specially like to thank nilgun n dilara at the front desk. The breakfast buffet was nice but had the same menu everyday. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Lesley2402
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed 4 nights at the Double Tree. I concur with other reviewers that the location was great and in easy reach either by walking or on the tram of the many key attractions. However at a rate of 175 euros per night this is very expensive against the local currency and we did expect very good service and assistance from the staff. However we did not find this the case in regard to requests relating to room service requirements and at the rooftop bar. We came to the conclusion there was either insufficent staff or they had not been trained well enough in customer service skills. It was not until we had stayed in other hotels in Turkey that we realised the Doubletree has a lot of catching up to do in respect to value for money and quality customer service across the organisation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations in every way”
Reviews.Author: cwuer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night post cruise. This place is awesome. The front staff is definitely one of the nicest, most helpful I have ever encountered. From the minute you walk into this hotel you get the "wow" factor. Very clean and modern. Loved our huge room with fabulous bath as well. It was a corner room and looked out onto a side street. I just sat in the window and watched the local activity. What a treat! So different from anything you would see at home. You will get some street noise at lower levels (we were on second floor) so if you are a light sleeper ask for a higher room. Did not bother us as we were so exhausted from exploring this fabulous city we slept with no problem on the heavenly beds. The locations is perfect! Tram right across the street, can walk to the bazaar in about 5 minutes. Really, it is just perfect. Oh, you must go up to the roof top terrace for drinks or dinner. Yes, it is expensive (gin and tonic about $12) but the view is incredible. You can see the harbor in the distance with close to 100 ships anchored, a sight to behold. The blue mosque is also in the background on the other side. Jaw dropping gorgeous. Front desk got us an early morning taxi to the airport and it was only $35. Try getting that without some help in Istanbul as the taxi drivers will rip you off in a hurry. Look no further, just book this place if going to Istanbul. It is perfect in every way. Oh, almost forgot, I left my Kindle in the room and guess what? Housekeeping turned it in! Just one more reason to compliment not only this hotel but it's management as they sure are good at finding outstanding employees and obviously have a great training program in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: cvcalcouple
Reviews.Content: Great location and nice, new and modern american style hotel. Large rooms. Tram right outside which can take you to many attractions including waterfront and spice bazaar. Walking distance to Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: WaialaeNui
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days. We picked it because of the location in Old Town. Best decision of the trip. Almost everything was within walking distance. The room was outstanding and the service was excellent with one insignificant slip up. The restaurant was just "okay" for dinner. However, the service was excellent. My wife didn't like the entrees she ordered both nights...the fish smelled too fishy for her and the next night's dish was too salty. Without our asking, the wait staff offered a replacement, no questions asked, when they saw that she had not touched the food. We were traveling with four other couples, two stayed at the Conrad, one at the Ritz Carlton, and two at Double Tree. After comparing notes, no question we were at the best hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good service culture”
Reviews.Author: jimbo1_7
Reviews.Content: we had a problem with the 1st floor street facing room we were staying in and were promptly moved to a corner room with a lovely terrace. we appreciated the good service and the desire to protect the hotel's reputation. We also found other staff, including the maids, to be courteous and helpful. the rooms were clean. negatives - internet connection slow, and required payment.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: eztrav
Reviews.Content: Service was really great. From the doorman to the maid service. They all really wanted to help and did so with a smile. As the doorman put it "we want you to feel at home". And I did! The location was... a bit strange. It's situated in a mall? so getting luggage to and from the front door was a bit odd. But because of the great service it didn't matter much. It's very close to the Blue Mosque which is good and which is bad. Bad because the cab drivers want to take you an extra few blocks to bring up the cab fare - because it's a bit close and they want more money, this was annoying! There is a public tram stop RIGHT there! which makes it very very convenient. Room was smallish. Would definitely insist on getting a room not facing the front next time. As it was in between seasons they had not turned off the heat and the only way to cool the room was to open the window, and that left the room a little bit noisy. Service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel close to main Istanbul attractions”
Reviews.Author: ArieLu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of a long holiday in Turkey. The hotel has been recently renovated and rooms are very nice and quiet. Breakfast is fantastic (service and food) and staff very nice. We were not lucky for the view from our room that was in the interior, so looking at another part of the hotel, but sleep quality was great! They welcome you with the typical Double Tree warm cookie, veeery good! Price is reasonable but in september when we came back to Istanbul was too high and we had to choose another hotel. It is very easy to arrive from the airport with underground and tram (35/40 min) and it is close to old town 5 min with tram, 15 min walking) from Santa Sofia. It is incredible that Hilton hotels still make you pay for internet connection in the room, but there is a free place where it is possible to use some pcs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel020
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect. Everything in Old Town was within walking distance. It was not an issue for us to walk the 20 minutes to get to the heart of Old Town. Follow the tram line and you won't get lost. An entrance to the Grand Bazaar is only a 5 minute walk away. This is a new hotel, and unfortunately not all taxi drivers know its location. Make sure to carry the hotel address. Upon check in, we were given a room directly above the entry way, on the main street. As I prefer to sleep with open windows, the room would have been extremely loud. A quick call to the front desk solved this dilemna and we were given a different room in a quiet location. This new room also provided a private and nice sized patio for our enjoyment. I found the room accommodations clean and comfortable. No complaints what-so-ever!

Reviews.Title: “A very frustrated room on the servant stairs”
Reviews.Author: maabdou2000
Reviews.Content: It was a shock for me when I wake up in the morning, open the windows then I see the scene: the servant stairs, staying in supposly 5 stairs Hotel and they has rooms looks on servant stairs. what a frustration then why I inquire , I have been told that my room is not paid , it has been paid by Hilton Rewards Points. on the other hand, Food was nice , very clean , people are friendly but not warm, they answer short answers. Like military base. located in a very nice shopping area , downtown, close to Sultan Ahmet Mosque. I would like to mention that they offer TAXI to Airport , very good price , friendlt drivers .

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: alperlma
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was very nice. As everyone mentioned, it is quite new and modern. The rooms are small but smart-looking and the bathrooms are particularly nice. Service is warm & friendly. One caveat that I should note: I disagree somewhat with the assessment that it is conveniently located. It's true that the tram stops right outside but it's the Laleli stop, which isn't quite in the heart of "Old Town" the way you'd think from the hotel's name. You are two stops away from the main Old Town sites, and nowhere near where anything is going on in the evening. We ended up meeting friends who were staying near Taksim Square and that was a much more lively and enjoyable place to spend an evening. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but horrible experience with their customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ad K
Reviews.Content: Reserved a single room with 2 beds in case my friend would join me. At check in, they told me to pay extra guest charges since reservation had only 1 person. I was shocked that they argued with me for the whole hour and were persistent to charge me an extra guest fee (50 euro/day). I did not expect from 5-star (in reality this is a 4-star hotel) hotel to treat its clients in a such, horrible, way and demand some non-sense fee at the time of check in. It is undeniably wrong and unacceptable. Apart from that, rooms are nice and location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome -- would definitely do it again.”
Reviews.Author: achates7
Reviews.Content: Great location 2 blocks from station on main tram line into historic area. Great staff, great price. Next time will try the Turkish bath there.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Lay Your Head and Branch Out To See Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Trevorbord
Reviews.Content: The DOubltree By Hilton, Istabul, Old Town is a very nice hotel located within striking distance of everything worth doing in Istanbul via the tram. The avenue it is located on is a very busy thoroughfare lined with shops, mosques, universities, and restaurants. The rooms are plush and spacious, the daily breakfast was inexpensive. We explored the rooftoop terrace and bar and redeemed our welcome drink coupon and had a few more and chatted up the staff. Right across the street from the hotel is a tram stop...For less than a dollar you are ten minutes away from the Blue Mosque, and the Hagia Sophia, the ferry landing for a trip up the Bosporus. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “loved it! would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: billy_haq
Reviews.Content: if your looking to stay and explore the old town sea of istanbul then the location of this hotel is perfect. the tram stop is right outside, with the grand bazaar just 2 stops away and sutlanhamet just 3. the hotel itself is very modern and clean. we had two rooms both which were of a good standard, although slightly on the small side. however you will find that small rooms are quite common in the city. there is a 24 hr gym and a spa with a sauna, steam room and turkish baths which is all really relaxing after a day in the city. we loved it here. the staff were friendly, breakfast was great and the beds are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a service!”
Reviews.Author: Limshang
Reviews.Content: As part of a 4 day stay in Istanbul, my wife and I stayed 2 nights in the DoubleTree by Hilton. Seldomly have I been impressed more by the excellent and warm service in a hotel. From the moment we arrived all the way to checkout, the staff was simply amazing: from the bellboy to the security guards, the supervisor in the gym, the cleaning staff , the lady who prepared my omelet at the eggstation in the morning as well as the people at the front desk: they all were so friendly and did everything within their powers to make our stay as comfortable as possible. This is a very new hotel and the whole setup including rooms and service facilities are very modern and new. The room is quite small but the setup is done well and we never had the feeling it was too small. The bathroom is very nice and large with a great walk in shower. As mentioned in many other reviews, the location of the hotel is perfect: 10 mins walk to the Grand Bazaar and 5 mins to the first tram stop from where you can get to all the big sights within minutes. For the old town you cannot be in a better location. The front desk people were extremely helpful in giving tips about when to go to which sites, they helped us make reservations at restaurants and without asking even printed a map and details which we could use to get there. They really made it a pleasure to come back after visiting the different sites in Istanbul. The gym was very good and the hotel offers a free hot tub, sauna and steam room (very nice!) and I also had a massage which was hands down the best I ever had. They also offer a turkish bath and would really recommend to consider this. Breakfast was good quality as well and also here service was great. The first morning it was very busy with a lot of people eating at the same time, but yet the staff stayed on top of things, proactive, friendly: very impressive. We did not eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel but had room service twice and both dishes were very good quality and tasty (try the mixed turkish dessert platter!) As a conclusion, we simply loved our stay and are truly impressed with the staff of this hotel. Without any doubt one of the best hotel experiences we have had ever.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gdl_traveler1
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in downtown Istambul. DonÂ´t expect any view to the Bosforus, but in change you will receive a great service, excellent buffet breakfast and a clean and comfortable room. Cost/benefit better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: erietta
Reviews.Content: nice new hotel and room, very clean. Front desk very helpfull. The sound of the mosque , in the middle of the night is quite annoying, but this could be an all around city issue. Tram stop exactly outside the hotel. Grand Bazzar 2 tram stops away (walkable distance)

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ali69_99
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife for a 4 night stay. I would highly recommend the DoubleTree , its relatively new , the location is excellent and the service is top notch . The breakfest buffee is varied and of a high calibre. I would definetly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: paradisedream11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June 2011 and found it be more central and closer to attactions such as the Grand Bazaar, Spice Market and a short tram ride to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace compared to Holiday Inn. Fantastic for a solo traveller or those travelling with family as this hotel is located opposite a tram stop. While it may not meet the criteria of a typical 5 star, it was one of the better hotels in terms of service and facilities such as spa, steam, turkish bath, gym, internet and a decent oom and nice cooked breakfast. Would I stay at this hotel again? Absolutely! With a great location and good value for money what is not to like about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient base for visiting the old city, but noisy and the service is not up to a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alberto L
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided me and my wife a convenient base for the visit of Istanbul attractions in the old city. The hotel is new, and the room was exactly as shown on the hotel website. Unfortunately I experienced few issues during my stay: shortly after arrival, a housekeeper walked into my room without knocking the door. As I reported such unprofessional behavior to the front desk, they offered small apology and I had no follow-up on the incident. Other less disturbing service faults confirmed my feeling that the service staff is not up to a 5 star hotel. Just few examples: at breakfast it was necessary to get the attention of the waiter for having the refill of coffee and orange juice; and one morning, the breakfast room supervisor made resistance for looking for a better table than the one (close to the entrance) that she wanted us to take. Another problem quite bothersome was that I was assigned a room facing a side street on which there were noisy truck / crane works till 1 am on both nights I was there (and in my booking and at check-in I had asked specifically for a quiet room). The sound insulation of the windows, though double pane, is ineffective as the noise seems passing through the windows frame. I imagine that this can be a significant issue for the rooms facing the main road on the front of the hotel. Overall I would rate the Doubletree by Hilton Old Town Istanbul more as a 4 star hotel (and 3.5 star for the service) rather than the 5 star advertised. I would recommend this hotel only if you adjust your expectations, and you are offered a room rate, in accordance to such level.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: H2where
Reviews.Content: Very new and clean, perfect location, good food. Concierge didn't really help as far as finding tours or other info but desk staff was great, even arranged for a taxi to get some medicine I needed. Only downside was that bathroom smelled a bit musty.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel in the heart of Old Town, Istanbul, Turkey”
Reviews.Author: holguincuba2002
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a wonderful trip to Istanbul, Turkey. I stayed two days at the hotel in late July and three days early August after my tour of Turkey. The staff were very knowledgeable about all aspects of Istanbul. As you enter the hotel lobby you pass through a "metal detector" similar to the airport. Remember, do not show any "water bottles" or "alcohol" as they will be given to you when you leave. Always keep water containers hidden in a carry on bag. The room was slightly on the "small" side, although the bathroom was large and ultra modern with walk in shower. No need to climb over a large bathtub which sometimes you need good balance. Sheets were changed daily and the room had a large Queen Bed and modern television. The room had a lovely view of the street. A great buffet breakfast was included in the "special price" which I paid for through Hilton. Another advantage of the hotel was walking distance to most of the Istanbul attractions including the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Archaeology Museum, Spice Market, Grand Bizarre (with 4000 shops) Bospherus River Cruises. I sometimes used the "tram" which is a large modern airconditioned street car which costs about one dollar. Taxis are available, all equipped with meters, although I only used a few times. All areas and backstreets that I visited were extremely safe for walking even late at night. The "highlight" of the trip was the Tour of Turkey by Trafalgar Tours. This tour comprised of twenty one tourists, mostly from USA. I was the only Canadian. It included two drivers and a tour guide who was extremely knowledgeable about life in Turkey as well as various places we visited including Pamukkale ,(the ancient city), Ephesus, Troy .. Breakfast and dinner were included at all five star hotels that we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, rooms, location; would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MDF-NYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 night on Hilton reward points. Wonderful hotel: great /friendly service (all front desk, and especially concierge Ali Camak); beautiful rooms, lobby, etc.; excellent breakfast; lovely roof terrace for dinner (food was very good) and drinks. Tram stop right outside the hotel, so easy access to all sites.
