Easy walking distance (at least for New Yorkers used to walking) to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, etc., though too hot to walk in July. Bed was a bit too soft for my taste, but my husband was fine. Only thing not as advertised was executive lounge. They don't have one, but said they've had no luck getting Hilton to remove that information from the web site. Because we didn't pay for the room, I cannot comment on value. Food in hotel was expensive, but not any more so than many Istanbul restaurants, and we had plenty of options. They will arrange airport transfers and put the fee on your hotel bill. Expensive, but worth it if you want the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at thsi hotel. The location was perfect for us. The tram stopped right in front of the hotel which made it very convenient when you get tired of walking. That said, you can easily walk to the Grand Bazzaar in about 5 minutes. We walked from the Blue Mosque one evening to walk off dinner at a liesurely pace and it took about 20 minutes. Behind the hotel there are many clothing shops if that's what you are in to. As to the hotel itself... the staff was very friendly and helpful, we checked in around 2 am and were greeted by an alert and couteous staff. I must say though that they did not give us a Hilton Gold upgrade, they did give us a very nice, big corner room. My only issue was that it was a bit noisy on the main road and second floor. After a night I got used to the noise. I did look at the terrace rooms which were smaller and quite dark, I really didnt plan on sitting ont he terrace. The breakfast was very good and quite complete. The terrace lounge on the top floor was very pretty and relaxing. Overall: You can't beat the location and amenities, I do think that they could do a better job cleaning the room, this is a new hotel and if they don't try a bit harder to maintain it then I think it will go down hill over time. For now, you can't miss booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary587
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel, everyting near, shopping, restaurants, tram, exchange etc... ROOMS Rooms are quite, clean, tiday but too small, some rooms are a bit bigger. Great effort done in cleaning rooms very well. Very comfortable room, good towels, good quality shampoo ect... RECEIPTION Smiling faces, very helpful specially Dilara, she was so helpful in everying and whenever, thank you Dilara. It is excellenent value of money specially for brand new hotel like Double Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- great location, lovely breakfast & very friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FKD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Blue mosque, Grand Bazaar and old town - without actually being in the middle of the tourist area. The tram stop is right outside the door & is perfect for getting around. Avoid taxis. The hotel staff were really helpfull & friendly. The housekeeping did a fantastic job - our rooms were always clean & fresh by lunch time. Breakfast was fantastic . A lovely spread of warm food, fruits, cereals, almost anything you could ask for. Our son was ill while we were on holiday. We called for a bucket of ice at 3am. No problem. It arrived immediately. At breakfast, they got him fruit he could eat from the kitchen - even though it was not part of the buffet that day. Really appreciated that !! Recommend this place to any one interested in a city holiday with sightseeing & shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great service”
Reviews.Author: odpalarm
Reviews.Content: Good location if you want to walk to the Grand Bazaar. The bed was so comfortable! Room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: mayjan16
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, rooms are clean and big, location was great just 5 minutes walk from the grand bazaar . the tram stops right in front of the hotel and taxi ride anywhere not so bad, try visiting the ICE Museam while in there its great about 20TL from the hotel in taxi

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelleynewyorklondon
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel,great rooms and very comfortable beds.The staf were very friendly,as the other reviews said the hotel l is in a great location for all, just in a short distance to old town.Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful! Will be back there.”
Reviews.Author: roamingworld
Reviews.Content: I visit Istanbul every year and have always stayed in the Sultanahmet area because of the convenience, despite the poor hotel quality. My experience on this trip was so bad that I moved out to the nearest reputable and yet reasonably priced hotel in the area. And I am so glad that I took the hassle of moving! I arrived at the hotel at 9 AM and the incredibly friendly front desk employee gave me a room, and per my request found a room which was really quiet. I read reviews which said that the rooms facing he main street can be noisy during the day, so take this into account when checking-in. I stay at the Hilton chain often, but this was the first time I chose the Double Tree by Hilton. I have to say that I loved every minute of my stay! The rooms are spacious, with very, very comfortable beds and lovely linens, nice lights, good TV, big bathrooms (with Nutrogena toiletries), beautiful slippers. The only thing is that my bathroom in the shower area had some sort of a smell, maybe from the drain. The Front desk staff was always very polite and helpful and helped me to confirm my flights. Forgot to mention the warm chocolate chip cookie I received on arrivial- obviously a Double Tree tradition! The complimentary fruit plate in my room was also a nice surprise. I read that the hotel has a few very nice restaurants but since I was traveling alone this time, I did not go. In all the reviews I have posted on the Trip Advisor I always try to be fair and to give all the details- good and bad, so despite my great satisfaction with this hotel, I need to mention the following three disadvantages the Double Tree has: 1. Location- the hotel is not in the Sultanahmet area where all the historic sights are and which is so pleasant to walk around at any time of the day. The hotel is about 20 minutes very slow walk downhill from Sultanahmet (I guess you can take this distance in 10 minutes if you walk faster). But on your way back it is all uphill walking so if you are tired you'd better take the tram. The good news is that there is a tram stop (the University stop) right in front of the hotel (1 token is 1.75 TL)- it is one stop to the Grand bazaar and three stops to Sultanahmet.The area around the hotel is nice and safe at night. 2. Internet charge- although not as expensive as the Hilton chain, you will have to pay for internet here- 15 TL for 24 hours. There is wired and WiFi, and is pretty fast. While all the hotels in the Sultanahmet area ofeer free internet, it is slow and sometimes- non existent. 3. Breakfast will cost you extra- I believe it is about 25 TL per person. I did not try it so can not comment on it. All the hotels in the Sultanahmet area offer free, even though sometimes with questionable quality, breakfast. Despite this, I believe that the Double Tree hotel is a great alternative to the small, noisy, cramped and often- privitive so-called boutique hotels in the Sultanahmet area. I will be staying in this hotel in all my future trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: marinhorserider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DoubleTree for 3 nights in early June. Overall the hotel is excellent - perfect location on the tram line - wonderful new rooms with comfortable beds. Nice bathrooms, lovely spa and a good (if expensive ) restaurant with rooftop terrace. Like most rooms in Istanbul they are small. Internet access is included and the breakfasts are very good too. I would recommend this hotel to both tourists and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: BrotherOctave
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here on HHonors ponts. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful, moreso than any other Doubletree than I have been in before and I travel about 34 weeks a year. The location was also great, right on a tram stop and within easy walking distance of the grand bazzar. The bar on the fifth floor is a great place to have a drink after those long tourist days and they actually have a drinkable white wine by the glass, a little difficult to find in some locations in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, walking distance from all major sights.”
Reviews.Author: guzbelgium
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 3 months old (formerly there was a school here), and at the doorstep of all old town attractions. When the usual Hilton asked 400 Euro/night, I tried this one. Taxis dont know it yet, ask for Laleli Mosquee or Crown Plaza Hotel (100m down the street). Clean, modern stylish rooms, flatscreen TV, good airco. Super helpfull personnel, all are clearly loving their jobs. Modern tram stops at the door and takes you to all attractions. Airport taxi costs 20 euro (or private driver 90 euro). This is the textile area, with many clothes, shoes, leather shops, frequented by many Russian buyers. The luxury rooms have a large terrace, great for sitting outside in evening (but no worthwile view). Breakfast and restaurant are very good, rooftop bar is OK (but the downtown rooftop bars have far greater views). Fitness in basement. I stayed at 1000+ hotels, this is a favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New & Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: TravelWriter7
Reviews.Content: Doubletree by Hilton has created a new gem in Istanbul's Old Town. This contemporary hotel has rooms that are spacious and beautifully designed with touches expected in a luxury hotel. The front desk staff made us feel right at home - with warm chocolate chip cookies upon arrival. The front desk supervisor, Bergen, was particularly welcoming and well informed as a concierge. We had a connecting room suite on this visit (king, connecting to two doubles) as we were traveling with teenage children, and it was perfect. The location, in the Beyazit area, is a short distance from the Blue Mosque and other highlights of Sultanahmet - walkable, or an easy taxi ride. The Grand Bazaar is a 5 minute walk. Plenty of shopping and restaurants are nearby. We booked a package in advance that included the buffet breakfast - a great way to start the day. What really makes this hotel is it's modern comfort and a well-trained, English-speaking staff that is out to make a great first impression for a relative newcomer on the Istanbul hotel scene. Side note: Would also recommend the Backpackers Travel Transport for airport transfer. â‚¬20 for a comfortable clean Mercedes van to your hotel (for our whole family, NOT per person!) [---]

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JD1316
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite luxurious, very clean and new. The location is strange in that it's pretty much inside a clothes mall but it is superbly located to explore Sultanahmet. The tram stop is just outside the door and you are not on an incline like the other hotels are so there is no uphill walking which was a blessing since we traveled with a young child and a stroller. It is a bit difficult to find supermarkets if you want to buy fruit / yogurt etc for your child but you can dive into the alleys to find them. We were hesitant to visit Istanbul as we wanted to stay in Sultanahmet and didn't like the look of the hotels here. We were lucky to find this one and I would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LisainHove
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Hilton's I've stayed in. Staff were professional and helpful and very friendly. Bed was one of the most comfortable ones I've ever slept in. Bathroom was lovely. Nice to be in the centre of everything and there was also a tram stop right outside. Would recommd especially if you can get a weekend deal

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel with top service”
Reviews.Author: tkwetina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 weeks. The hotel is brand new, very stylish and modern. If you read something about cold water and other issues- this was true when the hotel just opened., now fixed. Location: Tell the taxi driver to driver you to Laleli, nobody knows this hotel as it is brand new. When you pass the Crowne Plaza it is just 500m more up the street. Check-in and check out: Easy going. Breakfast: Just great! Better than in other fancy hotels I have stayed in Istanbul like the Grand Hyatt. Rooms: Modern and stylish room, nice bathroom with great shower. Some might rate rooms as a bit small, for me still OK as nobody stays here 24h. Hotel is busy over weekends but during the week especially nice for business customers as not many people stay there. Staff is excellent, very well trained. Reception guys are multi language, e.g all speak German, Mr. Kemal speaks German, 1 guy French etc.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Marpesia26
Reviews.Content: Old town is at your doorstep, this new hotel is in a great location and reasonably priced. The tram stops right in front of the hotel, you can save yourself a cab ride and take the tram to and from teh airport. The staff was very friendly and helpful. As you are in Old Town the street noise can be a bit bothersome, but it is not awful as you are trying to sleep at night. You can walk to most of the main attractions or take the tram. Remember the restaurants in that area are likely to be overpriced, but if you move a bit out of old town you can find some great food for great values.

Reviews.Title: “New and modern hotel in the heart of old town”
Reviews.Author: Dmitryvulkan
Reviews.Content: This was a very good stay and an excellent choice. I was nicely surprised by the modern design and the fact that this hotel is new. I first was thinking about Barcelo hotel on the same street but when arrived I was so glad that I had chosen Doubletree - Barcelo is way too old and not modern. Doubletree has a very nice terrace with food and wine available. I need to say though that their double rooms are very small - no space at all... and you would need to pay for internet connection extra ( around 7 EUR). Breakfast is buffet style but not really excellent that would make you eat their every morning and besides it is way overpriced (around 20 EUR per person). Some of the rooms face the oposite building or the windows are inside of the hotel and you do not have the view at all... In sum, I'd still recommend staying in this hotel if you need to be close to Sultanahmed of Istanbul as it is one of the best avaialble in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel by far with the best staff I have ever seen!!”
Reviews.Author: mswathi
Reviews.Content: I happen to visit istanbul with my mom and my friend last week and we stayed at the doubletree the entire time. Everything about the hotel was awesome. The staff by far were exceptional. Everyone from the door man to the receptionist to the spa people were soo friendly and soo nice. They are soo attentive and help you with anything at any time of the day. My favorite was Kemal. He was a gem. He used to suggest restaurants to eat at and would call them and make reservations for us. Some of those places even have their own shuttles that pick you up from the hotel to take you to eat at the restaurant and would bring you back when you're done. Another thing is that it is so close to the train station. You walk outside and there it is. This made travelling to different places so much easier. In addition, you're only a 10 minute walk from sultanamet, grand bazar, and hagia sophia as well if you don't want to take the train... The hotel has a good breakfast and their spa was awesome. It has a steam room, sauna, jacuzii and a turkish bath, which were all free to the hotel guests plus a 24 hour gym. The only thing i didn't like about our room was that the bathroom has a slight odor of drainage but besides that I couldn't find a thing wrong with the place. I loved turkey and being in this hotel probably helped it even more.. I would definately stay at this same hotel if I go back to Istanbul..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent”
Reviews.Author: paulmac44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really on the money - location is near enough to the Old Town without being in the middle of it, it is right at the tram stop, service is excellent, staff friendly and courteous, rooftop restaurant is terrific

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: virgc24
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice, the beds comfortable and the staff very friendly. As other reviews have said, the location was good for sightseeing in the old town and once you have got the hang of the public transport, it's easy enough to get further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Some ups, some downs.”
Reviews.Author: Hollbe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Doubletree for 3 nights in April. On arrival we were brought to a room overlooking the busy main street (dispute asking for a quiet room). Even at 11pm you could clearly hear the cars racing by so we called down and were moved to a room with windows opening to the inside of the hotel (not ideal but quiet). For 2 days the aircon wasn't workin properly and dispite it "being fix" 3 times the room remained 27/28 Celsius, and without a window to the outside it was very uncomfortable. After them suggesting they send up an engineer for the 4th time we put our foot down and insisted to be moved. They were apologetic and responded quickly, moving us to an upgraded room on a quiet street with aircon (perfect!). Â So we had a lovely 3rd night there. It seems it's a bit of 'luck of the draw' to what room you get.Â  Apart from the aircon problems we had a nice stay.Â The breakfast was great, a huge buffet spread with everything from eggs/bacon to pastries/cereal and fresh fruit/juice. The staff were friendly (not always helpful but they tried).Â  The location is good. It's in walking distance to the main sights and right beside a tram stop.Â  It was an average hotel stay and for the money there are probably many other hotels worth checking out, which is what I will be doing if I ever return to Istanbul.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Istanbul - Old Town
HotelInfo.Address: Ordu Caddesi No:31, Istanbul 34130, Turkey
